creditline: The Jane and James Emison Endowment for Native American Art
culture: Fond du Lac Band of Lake Superior Chippewa
description: a: "dad": rectangular textile with back ground; 8 horizontal rectangular shapes, top two are white, bottom six are red; gold warp b: "me": rectangular textile with back ground; 8 horizontal rectangular shapes, top five are white, bottom three are red; gold warp c: "mom": rectangular textile with back ground; 8 horizontal rectangular shapes, all are white; gold warp
life_date: American (Fond du Lac Band of Lake Superior Chippewa), born 1989
text: Family Portrait represents blood quantum, the percentage of Indian blood, of my parents and myself. My dad is mostly Native American and my mom is Irish and German. Even though I am mostly “white” I still identify myself as being Native American, but why' In this piece I am exploring and questioning ideas and systems of “authenticity.” —Maggie Thompson
title: Family Portrait
